Architecture Minor.description: A minor in architecture is directed toward Rensselaer students interested in architecture as asocio-cultural phenomenon, the student who intends to study architecture at the graduate level,and/or those envisioning a career in some segment of the building industry. The minor program provides an exposure to architecturewhat it is, what it includes, its history, how it is accomplished; and to architectswho they are and how they think and work. In order to earn a minor in architecture, students must compile at least 16 credits of architecture-related courses except for Architecture Design Studio, which is for B.Arch. majors only.

Environmental Design.description: The minor in Environmental Design is a 17-credit cross-school, interdisciplinary minor focused on developing skills related to environmentally sustainable design while developing students' critical understanding of the social and cultural context of sustainability debates and environmental justice. As an interdisciplinary minor, students are required to take at least one course from the School of Humanities, Arts, and Social Sciences and one course from the School of Architecture, with the remaining credits being freely selected from applicable courses. Courses are offered at both the Troy campus as well as CASE in New York City, enabling students to spend a semester at CASE while fulfilling minor requirements.
Environmental Design.name: Environmental Design

General Psychology Minor.description: The customized minor is designed for students who want to sample a variety of topics within psychology or select a set of courses that share a common theme.
General Psychology Minor.name: General Psychology Minor
General Psychology Minor.remaining_header: Three additional PSYC courses, with at least one at the 4000 level.

Graphic Design Minor.description: Study graphic design through the integration of theory and practice, in print and digital media. Use creative and critical thinking to solve visual communication problems and reach target audiences with words, symbols, and images.
Graphic Design Minor.name: Graphic Design Minor

History Minor.description: The minor in History is designed for students interested in the U.S. and world history. Courses primarily focus on the social history and evolution of technology, scientific enterprise, medicine, and law.
History Minor.name: History Minor
History Minor.remaining_header: Remaining credits from the following 4000-level options:

Information Technology and Web Science M.name: Information Technology and Web Science Minor

Interactive Media/Data Design Minor.description: This minor covers communication, interaction, and information design theory and practice to prepare students for creating different forms of interactive, multimedia communication, and data representation.
Interactive Media/Data Design Minor.name: Interactive Media/Data Design Minor

Lighting Minor.description: The minor in lighting gives students the awareness and the confidence to extend their creative work through controlled use of light. The program covers human responses to light, both visual andnon-visual, and the means by which light is produced and controlled. Interactions of light with form, texture, and color are examined in the contexts of daylight, electric lighting, and their integration. The Lightingminor requires 15 credits.
Lighting Minor.name: Lighting Minor

Lighting Minor in Biological Sciences.description: This minor program is offered as a joint program by the Department of Biological Sciences and the Lighting Research Center.
Lighting Minor in Biological Sciences.name: Lighting Minor in Biological Sciences

Literature and Creative Writing Minor.description: The Literature and Creative Writing minor offers discussion-oriented courses across a range of literary genres and themes, with a choice of emphasis on either literature, creative writing, or both. Students will learn to read and write literary art critically and creatively, with clarity and imagination, and with sensitivity to multi-cultural expressions of diversity.
Literature and Creative Writing Minor.name: Literature and Creative Writing Minor

Materials Engineering Minor.description: Students not majoring in Materials Engineering may receive a minor in this discipline by completing 15 credit hours of courses with a MTLE designation. As general preparation for these courses,students should have taken ENGR 1600 Materials Science for Engineers.
Materials Engineering Minor.name: Materials Engineering Minor

Mathematics Minor.description: Students not majoring in mathematics may receive a minor in math by taking four courses at the 4000 level or above from the MATH and MATP course groups. These courses should form a coherent program and have the prior approval of the chairman of the Department of Mathematical Sciences.
Mathematics Minor.name: Mathematics Minor

Media and Culture Minor.description: This minor examines different forms of expression and their cultural contexts in a variety of media, including film, television, photography, and new media. Its components will enhance creative and critical thinking, communication practices, and awareness of cultural and individual identities.
Media and Culture Minor.name: Media and Culture Minor

Music Minor.description: A music minor consists of 16credits from the music curriculum. Students may select 12 credits from any combination of courses at the 1000 and 2000 levels. The remaining 4 credits should be earned at the 4000 level, or by approved substitution at the 2000 level.
Music Minor.name: Music Minor

Nuclear Engineering Minor.description: Students not majoring in nuclear engineering may receive a minor in this discipline by completing 1516 credit hours of study selected in consultation with their program adviser.

Philosophy Minor.description: The Minor in Philosophy allows the interested student to attain a foundation in philosophy that will complement any academic major.
Philosophy Minor.name: Philosophy Minor

Philosophy of Logic, Computation, and Mi.description: This minor focuses on the nature of reasoning and formal systems, and the relations they bear on the study of mind and consciousness whether natural or artificial (artificial intelligence, AI).

Public Health Minor.description: The minor in Public Health is designed for students interested in health-related careers who wish to develop skills and knowledge about global public health challenges. It also offers important courses for students on a pre-medical track.

Strategic Communication Minor.description: The minor in Strategic Communication is designed to train versatile, critical, and self-possessed communicators. Students who successfully complete this minor will demonstrate the ability to make focused, audience-appropriate arguments and communicate effectively across diverse rhetorical, sociocultural, and disciplinary contexts.
Strategic Communication Minor.name: Strategic Communication Minor

Studio Arts.description: A studio arts minor consists of 16 credits from the studio arts curriculum, which includes courses in drawing, painting, and sculpture. All studio arts minors must take three studio courses, and at least one of these must be at the 4000 level. The remaining 4 credits may be filled by another studio course or an art history course.
Studio Arts.name: Studio Arts

Sustainability Studies Minor.description: The minor in Sustainability Studies focuses on the interactions between various systemssocial, political, cultural, economic, technological, and ecological that undergird environmental sustainability. Students use interdisciplinary approaches to investigate environmental problems.
Sustainability Studies Minor.name: Sustainability Studies Minor

Video, Performance, and Social Practice.description: Theminor allows students to study video, performance and social impact through the integration of theory and practice. Students are prepared to analyze and critique moving images; plan, produce and edit their own media productions in video/television and/or performance; and communicate through visual as well as audio medium. Strategically situating art, media and technology in a social context, students engage in a creative practice designed to make the change from the local to the global.
Video, Performance, and Social Practice.name: Video, Performance, and Social Practice
Video, Performance, and Social Practice.remaining_header: The remaining (at least) 8 credits should be from:

Well-being.description: How do people maintain a sense of well-being in their lives? Each person's path to well-being in body and mind is uniquearising from an awareness of his or her needs, goals, and what each finds fulfilling. The Well-being minor includes a wide variety of courses that explore the nature of what it is to be human and to orient oneself in the world, to have relationships, make decisions, be creative, and make discoveries. Sixteen credits are required for the minor in Well-being.
Well-being.name: Well-being
